Abra.description: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.

Aerodactyl.description: This vicious Pokemon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.

Alakazam.description: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

Arbok.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

Arcanine.description: This legendary Chinese Pokemon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

Articuno.description: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

Beedrill.description: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

Bellsprout.description: A carnivorous Pokemon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

Blastoise.description: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

Bulbasaur.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokemon.

Butterfree.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

Caterpie.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

Chansey.description: Being few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the Trainer who catches it.

Charizard.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

Charmander.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

Charmeleon.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

Clefable.description: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

Clefairy.description: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

Cloyster.description: Even a missile can't break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They're even harder than its shell.

Cubone.description: Tal's favorite Pokemon! Cubone's both cute and completely hardcore.

Dewgong.description: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

Diglett.description: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

Ditto.description: Duncan's favorite Pokemon (he has an awesome painting of Ditto on his wall). It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.

Dodrio.description: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

Doduo.description: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.

Dragonair.description: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

Dragonite.description: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

Dratini.description: Long considered a mythical Pokemon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

Drowzee.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

Dugtrio.description: A team of triplets that can burrow over 60 MPH. Due to this, some people think it's an earthquake.

Eevee.description: Sven's favorite Pokemon! Due to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokemon conceals many different possible evolutions.

Ekans.description: It always hides in grass. When first born, it has no poison, so its bite is painful, but harmless.

Electabuzz.description: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.

Electrode.description: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.

Exeggcute.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

Exeggutor.description: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the 3 heads thinks about whatever it likes.

Farfetch'd.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

Fearow.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

Flareon.description: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.

Gastly.description: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

Gengar.description: Chadi's favorite Pokemon! It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

Geodude.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

Gloom.description: Smells incredibly foul! However, around 1 out of 1,000 people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

Golbat.description: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and suck blood.

Goldeen.description: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots.

Golduck.description: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

Golem.description: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.

Graveler.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

Grimer.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

Growlithe.description: Conner's favorite Pokemon ('It's adorable'). It has a brave and trustworthy nature and fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

Gyarados.description: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.

Haunter.description: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.

Hitmonchan.description: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

Hitmonlee.description: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

Horsea.description: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.

Hypno.description: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.

Ivysaur.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

Jigglypuff.description: Garrett's favorite Pokemon! When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

Jolteon.description: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

Jynx.description: It has several different cry patterns, each of which seems to have its own meaning.

Kabuto.description: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

Kabutops.description: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

Kadabra.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

Kakuna.description: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

Kangaskhan.description: To protect its young, it will never give up during battle, no matter how badly wounded it is.

Kingler.description: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly.

Koffing.description: If one gets close enough to it when it expels poisonous gas, the gas swirling inside it can be seen.

Krabby.description: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.

Lapras.description: Nicole's favorite Pokemon! Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.

Lickitung.description: Its tongue spans almost 7 feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.

Machamp.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

Machoke.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

Machop.description: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

Magikarp.description: A pathetic excuse for a Pokemon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.

Magmar.description: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.

Magnemite.description: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.

Magneton.description: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet.

Mankey.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

Marowak.description: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

Meowth.description: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

Metapod.description: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

Mew.description: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokemon.

Mewtwo.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

Moltres.description: This legendary Pokemon scatters embers with every flap of its wings. It is a thrilling sight to behold.

Mr. Mime.description: Always practices its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn't.

Muk.description: As it moves, a very strong poison leaks from it, making the ground there barren for three years.

Nidoking.description: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

Nidoqueen.description: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

Nidoran(F).description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokemon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

Nidoran(M).description: It stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

Nidorina.description: When resting deep in its burrow, its thorns always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.

Nidorino.description: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.

Ninetales.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

Oddish.description: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.

Omanyte.description: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokemon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.

Omastar.description: Apparently, it cracked Shellder's shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.

Onix.description: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

Paras.description: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.

Parasect.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

Persian.description: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.

Pidgeot.description: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.

Pidgeotto.description: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distinguish the movements of its prey.

Pidgey.description: Jeffrey's favorite Pokemon! Because it dislikes fighting, it protects itself by kicking up sand.

Pikachu.description: Melissa's favorite Pokemon! When several Pikachu gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

Pinsir.description: When the temperature drops at night, it sleeps on treetops or among roots where it is well hidden.

Poliwag.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

Poliwhirl.description: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.

Poliwrath.description: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.

Ponyta.description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes. Not to be confused with the 20% cooler PonyTA.

Porygon.description: A manmade Pokemon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.

Primeape.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

Psyduck.description: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but it is not known if it intends to do so.

Raichu.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

Rapidash.description: Very competitive, this Pokemon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

Raticate.description: Its whiskers help it to maintain balance. Its fangs never stop growing, so it gnaws to pare them down.

Rattata.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

Rhydon.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

Rhyhorn.description: It doesn't care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.

Sandshrew.description: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.

Sandslash.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

Scyther.description: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes which can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.

Seadra.description: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

Seaking.description: The horn on its head is sharp like a drill. It bores a hole in a boulder to make its nest.

Seel.description: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg-filled oceans.

Shellder.description: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

Slowbro.description: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.

Slowpoke.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

Snorlax.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

Spearow.description: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

Squirtle.description: Whitaker's favorite Pokemon! After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

Starmie.description: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in 7 colors.

Staryu.description: An enigmatic Pokemon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

Tangela.description: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.

Tauros.description: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd's protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.

Tentacool.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

Tentacruel.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

Vaporeon.description: As it uses the fins on the tip of its tail to swim, it blends with the water perfectly.

Venomoth.description: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

Venonat.description: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

Venusaur.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

Victreebel.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

Vileplume.description: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

Voltorb.description: It was discovered when Poke balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

Vulpix.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

Wartortle.description: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

Weedle.description: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

Weepinbell.description: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.

Weezing.description: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

Wigglytuff.description: Its body is full of elasticity. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.

Zapdos.description: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

Zubat.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
